summary.body: My brother in law called me up tonight to tell me a team from the Barbican was on University Challenge competing against one from the Society for the Preservation of Ancient Buildings.  However, i missed the start and would like to write a news item on this for Barbican Life.  Can anyone who may have watched, or happens to know, whether the Barbican team was drawn from the staff of the Barbican Centre, or from residents?  I also only managed to pick up the team's surnames - can anyone supply me with their forenames too? Thanks
summary.subject: University Challenge

summary.body: has anyone spotted the ad for the new observer format?  it includes lovely shots of the barbican... so not only is it the best sunday paper by miles but is also the most tasteful
summary.subject: lovely ad

summary.body: Hi The Observer are interested in doing a feature on designery flats in the barbican (and their owners), to flag up the Barbican tours taking place during the London Architecture Biennale in June. If your flat is ready for its close up then do send some snaps of  it to    the PR company for the biennale by next Tuesday 2nd May. For more info on the events during the festival check out   tickets go on sale in a week.
summary.subject: observer article on barbie flats

summary.body: Anyone else saw a very brief shot just before the credits on the Locaton Location Location rental special showing a shot from Ben Jonson House over to the pub?
summary.subject: Phil & Kirsty

summary.body: Hi there, I write a regular feature for Time Out Magazine called Homes with History which focuses on architecturally striking homes in London with a fascinating heritage. I am very keen to  feature a flat in the Barbican, ideally one with panoramic views though I am interested in hearing from anyone who might like to be interviewed. The piece would require a short interview and a couple of pictures with a resident within their property and we could arrange it to all take place on the same day. The interview usually takes about 45 minutes and the photographs an hour or so. It would be great to arrange something for this week so that the feature could run around Aug 16. Is this something that would interest you? If so please do get in contact:   07956 872 694.
summary.subject: Barbican flat for Time Out
